content: round 2 2ch counts as double_crochet + 1ch *miss 1 st double_crochet 1ch repeat from * along the first side work double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in corner 1ch then repeat from * again along the second side the top edge is worked slightly differently after working double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in the corner space 1ch *double_crochet in next 2 sts 1ch repeat from * to the last corner double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in corner 1ch join with a slip_stitch into the first space of the round and fasten_off you ll end up with 1ch spaces between every stitch on the two sides and between every pair of stitches on the top edge the final round of edging will be worked into these spaces the edging i used my contrast colour toy for this join the yarn to any 1ch space on the first side make 3ch and then slip_stitch into the next space all along the side you can treat the corner spaces the same as the other spaces when you get to the top edge work 4ch between slip stitches to allow for the bigger gap finish the round by slip stitching into the first 3ch space and fastening off the finished shawl shouldn t need blocking so you just have to decide how to wear it now that top edge folds over to make a nice collar abbreviations chain chain treble_crochet treble us double_crochet space space st / sts stitch / stitches double_crochet double_crochet us single_crochet © frankie brown 2019 my patterns are for personal use only and should not be used to make items for sale please do not use them for teaching purposes without my permission
